articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian and European officials pushed back this week against some U.S. proposals on how to end Russia's war in Ukraine, making counterproposals on issues from territory to sanctions, according to the full texts of the proposals seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Documents show differences over U.S. peace drive for Ukraine

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: U.S. officials arrested a Wisconsin judge on Friday and charged her with helping a man evade immigration authorities in what appeared to be a dispute between President Donald Trump's administration and local officials over immigration enforcement.
articles.title: US officials arrest Milwaukee judge for obstructing immigration operation

articles.author: Andrew Silver, Trixie Yap, Gram Slattery
articles.description: China exempted some U.S. imports from its steep tariffs in a sign on Friday that the trade war between the two countries could be easing, though China quickly knocked down U.S. President Donald Trump's assertion that negotiations were underway.
articles.title: China waives tariffs on some U.S. goods, but denies Trump's claim that talks are underway

articles.author: Ted Hesson, Kristina Cooke
articles.description: After Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Taras Atamanchuk found safety for his family near Houston, Texas.
articles.title: In first 100 days, Trump tells migrants 'leave the United States'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that he pushed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to allow food and medicine into the devastated Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Trump says he pushed Netanyahu on Gaza aid

articles.author: Fayaz Bukhari, Shivam Patel
articles.description: Armed police and soldiers searched homes and forests for militants in Indian Kashmir and India's army chief visited the area to review security, after the killing of 26 men earlier this week - the worst attack on civilians in nearly two decades.
articles.title: India searches for militants in Kashmir, as tensions soar with Pakistan

articles.author: Jan Strupczewski
articles.description: The United States and the European Union still need a lot of work to reach a deal that would prevent the imposition of tariffs on each other's goods, EU Economic Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis said on Friday.
articles.title: US and EU not close to deal on tariffs - EU's Dombrovskis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Queues of faithful filed into St. Peter's throughout the night and in the early hours, on the last day to bid farewell to Pope Francis ahead of his funeral on Saturday.
articles.title: Faithful flock to St. Peter's on last day to pay respects to pope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan believes an international investigation is needed into the killing of 26 men at a tourist spot in Indian Kashmir this week and is willing to work with international investigators, the New York Times reported on Friday, quoting Pakistani Defence Minister Khawaja Muhammad Asif.
articles.title: Pakistan minister urges international probe of Kashmir attack, NYT reports

articles.author: Jasper Ward
articles.description: A former commander in the Taliban has pleaded guilty to taking an American journalist and two Afghan nationals hostage in Afghanistan and Pakistan in 2008 and 2009, the U.S. Justice Department said on Friday.
articles.title: Ex-Taliban commander pleads guilty to taking US journalist hostage
